DATA_PACKAGE_PAGE.importer_hint:
Import spectral data and metadata.

Supported Formats:
‚Ä¢ Single files: CSV, TXT, ASC, PKL
‚Ä¢ Single folder: Contains multiple data files
‚Ä¢ Multiple folders: Parent folder with subfolders (batch import)

Tips:
‚Ä¢ Drag & drop files/folders or use browse buttons
‚Ä¢ Auto-preview updates when data is loaded
‚Ä¢ Metadata can be imported from JSON files

ML_PAGE.load_model_security_warning_text:
Model files (.pkl) are pickled Python objects. Loading an untrusted file can execute arbitrary code on your computer.

Only load model files you trust.

File:
{path}

Continue?
ML_PAGE.error_no_report: No classification report is available to export.
ML_PAGE.eval_summary_warning_by_spectra: Split mode is 'by_spectra' (random spectra). This can leak dataset-specific signatures into both train and test. Prefer 'by_dataset' for a more realistic estimate.
ML_PAGE.eval_summary_warning_dataset_overlap: Train/test datasets overlap (n={count}). This strongly suggests leakage.
ML_PAGE.eval_summary_ci_note: CI95 is bootstrap over spectra (not dataset-aware).
ML_PAGE.eval_summary_dataset_note: Dataset-level metrics use majority vote across spectra in each dataset.
ML_PAGE.error_no_group_data: Please create at least 2 groups and add datasets to them.
ML_PAGE.error_no_model: No trained model is available. Train or load a model first.
ML_PAGE.external_eval_requires_true_label_confus: Confusion matrix requires a true label.
ML_PAGE.external_eval_requires_true_label_roc: ROC requires probability outputs and a true label.

PREPROCESS.output_name_required: Please enter an output dataset name
PREPROCESS.pipeline_empty: Please add at least one step to the pipeline

PREPROCESS.toggle_existing_step_tooltip: Toggle whether to re-execute existing steps
PREPROCESS.new_step_tooltip: New step - will always be executed
PREPROCESS.existing_step_tooltip: Existing preprocessing step - use checkbox to control re-execution
PREPROCESS.multi_select_hint:
Multi-Selection:
‚Ä¢ Hold Ctrl (or Cmd) + Click to select multiple datasets
‚Ä¢ Hold Shift + Click to select a range
PREPROCESS.multi_dataset_hint:
Multi-Dataset Processing:
When multiple datasets are selected, they will be combined and processed together as one output dataset. The preprocessing pipeline applies to all selected data simultaneously.
PREPROCESS.pipeline_building_hint:
Build and manage preprocessing pipelines.

Tips:
‚Ä¢ Drag & drop to reorder steps
‚Ä¢ Use eye button to enable/disable steps
‚Ä¢ Import/export pipelines for reuse
‚Ä¢ Select a step to configure its parameters
PREPROCESS.parameters_hint:
Configure parameters for the selected preprocessing step.

Tip: Adjust values to fine-tune preprocessing behavior. Changes update the preview automatically.
PREPROCESS.visualization_hint:
Real-time preview of preprocessing results.

Tip: Toggle preview ON/OFF with the button. Use the refresh button to manually update, or the focus button to auto-zoom to signal regions.
PREPROCESS.output_config_hint:
Specify the output dataset name.

Tip: Use descriptive names to identify your preprocessed data easily. The output will be saved in the project's dataset collection.
PREPROCESS.select_all_tooltip: Select/deselect all datasets in current tab
PREPROCESS.export_no_selection: Please select a dataset to export
PREPROCESS.export_no_location_warning:
Please select a folder location before exporting.

Click the 'Browse...' button to choose where to save your files.
PREPROCESS.export_no_filename_warning: Please provide a filename for the export
PREPROCESS.export_invalid_location: Selected export location does not exist
PREPROCESS.export_metadata_tooltip: Export preprocessing pipeline and dataset information as a separate JSON file
PREPROCESS.export_multiple_names_info: Multiple datasets will be exported using their original names
PREPROCESS.export_multiple_partial: Export completed with warnings: {success} successful, {failed} failed out of {total} total
PREPROCESS.add_step_tooltip: Add step to pipeline with selected category and method
PREPROCESS.toggle_existing_tooltip: Toggle enable/disable for all existing preprocessing steps
PREPROCESS.norm_l1_desc: L1 norm (sum of absolute values) - robust to outliers, emphasizes total intensity
PREPROCESS.norm_l2_desc: L2 norm (Euclidean length) - standard vector normalization, preserves relative intensity ratios
PREPROCESS.norm_max_desc: Max norm (maximum absolute value) - scales spectrum to peak intensity, useful for peak comparison

CONFIRM_DIALOG.output_combined_hint: All selected datasets will be merged and saved as a single dataset with the specified output name.
CONFIRM_DIALOG.output_separate_hint: Each dataset will be processed individually and saved with its original name plus '_processed' suffix.

DIALOGS.preprocessed_to_raw_message:

Preview will be automatically enabled to show processing effects.

ANALYSIS_PAGE.no_datasets_message: Please load at least one dataset before running analysis.

Only continue if you trust this project.

ANALYSIS_PAGE.no_project_open: No project is currently open. Please open or create a project first.
ANALYSIS_PAGE.dataset_hint:
Select one or more datasets for analysis.

Filters:
‚Ä¢ All: Show all datasets
‚Ä¢ Preprocessed: Only preprocessed data

Multi-select: Hold Ctrl/Cmd to select multiple datasets
ANALYSIS_PAGE.dataset_selection_hint:
Select one or more datasets for analysis.

Filters:
‚Ä¢ Raw: Original spectral data
‚Ä¢ Preprocessed: Data processed through pipeline
‚Ä¢ All: Show all datasets

Multi-select: Hold Ctrl/Cmd to select multiple datasets
ANALYSIS_PAGE.auto_assign_no_groups_message:
Please create at least one group before using Auto-Assign.

Click 'Create Group' to get started.
ANALYSIS_PAGE.method_selection_hint:
Choose an analysis method from three categories:

‚Ä¢ Exploratory: PCA, UMAP, t-SNE, clustering
‚Ä¢ Statistical: Spectral comparison, peak analysis, ANOVA
‚Ä¢ Visualization: Heatmaps, overlay plots, waterfall plots
ANALYSIS_PAGE.parameters_hint:
Configure parameters for the selected analysis method.

Parameters are dynamically generated based on the chosen method.
Hover over parameter labels for detailed descriptions.
ANALYSIS_PAGE.quick_stats_hint:
View quick statistics about selected datasets and analysis results.

Shows:
‚Ä¢ Selected datasets count
‚Ä¢ Total spectra count
‚Ä¢ Analysis execution time and summary

ANALYSIS_PAGE.no_data_table: No data table available for this analysis
ANALYSIS_PAGE.select_datasets_prompt: Please select at least one dataset
ANALYSIS_PAGE.select_datasets_hint: Select at least {min_count} dataset(s) for this analysis
ANALYSIS_PAGE.comparison_mode_hint: Select datasets to compare. Hold Ctrl/Cmd to select multiple.
ANALYSIS_PAGE.insufficient_datasets_message: This method requires at least {required} dataset(s), but only {selected} selected.
ANALYSIS_PAGE.too_many_datasets_message: This method accepts a maximum of {max} dataset(s), but {selected} selected.
ANALYSIS_PAGE.datasets_not_found: The following datasets were not found: {datasets}
ANALYSIS_PAGE.group_assignment_header: üí° Assign datasets to labeled groups for comparison (e.g., 'Control', 'Disease', 'Treatment A'). You can create one group with multiple datasets or multiple groups for classification.
ANALYSIS_PAGE.group_name_placeholder: Enter group name (e.g., Control, MM, MGUS)...
ANALYSIS_PAGE.no_groups_defined: No groups defined yet. Select datasets and add them to a group.

METHOD_DESC.pca: Dimensionality reduction using PCA to identify variance patterns
METHOD_DESC.umap: Non-linear dimensionality reduction preserving local and global structure
METHOD_DESC.tsne: Non-linear dimensionality reduction for cluster visualization
METHOD_DESC.hierarchical_clustering: Hierarchical cluster analysis with dendrogram visualization
METHOD_DESC.pls_da: Supervised latent-variable projection maximizing class separation (chemometrics)
METHOD_DESC.lda: Supervised discrimination of groups; optionally PCA before LDA
METHOD_DESC.mcr_als: Non-negative spectral unmixing into component spectra and abundances
METHOD_DESC.nmf: Non-negative decomposition into basis spectra and coefficients
METHOD_DESC.ica: Blind source separation into statistically independent components
METHOD_DESC.outlier_detection: Identify anomalous spectra using robust distance or isolation methods
METHOD_DESC.silhouette_analysis: Evaluate clustering quality across a range of k values
METHOD_DESC.spectral_comparison: Compare mean spectra across groups with statistical testing
METHOD_DESC.peak_analysis: Automated peak detection with statistical comparison
METHOD_DESC.pairwise_tests: Wavenumber-wise significance testing between two datasets
METHOD_DESC.band_ratio: Compute biochemical band ratios (e.g., protein/lipid) per spectrum
METHOD_DESC.mean_spectra_overlay: Overlay mean spectra from different groups/datasets
METHOD_DESC.derivative_spectra: Visualize 1st/2nd derivatives to enhance peak resolution

‚Ä¢ Keywords: 'MM_Sample1' ‚Üí 'MM'
‚Ä¢ Prefix: 'Control_01' ‚Üí 'Control'
‚Ä¢ Alpha prefix: 'Treatment-A-1' ‚Üí 'Treatment'

Tip: Use clear naming conventions for automatic grouping.
